attributes.action: ensure a fair distribution of lottery grants/funds
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I'd like the prime minister to ensure that lottery grants/funds get distributed evenly based on population %.

The searches were done from the lottery grants website and based on 1 search only with the religious keyword (EG Christian) within the 'receiver' field.

Population data was taken from the national statistics website and is from a sample they took of 60,000 people. I've chosen £65million as a base-population figure for the uk (again taken from the website). Please note that the population sample is from April 2001.

The results are :

46,540,000 Christian people making 71.6% of population. £11,794,558 in lottery grants, making £0.25 per person

1,755,000 Muslim people making 2.7 % of population. £5,258,197 in lottery grants, making £2.30 per person

650,000 Hindu people making 1 % of population. £3,773,834 in lottery grants, making £5.81 per person

325,000 Jewish people making 0.5% of population. £8,924,609 in lottery grants, making £27.46 per person.

In a multicultural society all faiths should be equal, so lottery grant-distribution should be looked at.
